boardgame.name: Star Wars: Epic Duels
boardgame.description: Individual battles between famous Star Wars characters set on different board locations. Players choose a major character that is accompanied by one or two minor characters. Each set of characters has its own deck of cards which are used for attack, defense, or special abilities. Each deck is unique with certain special powers relevant to the major character. There are different modes of play; one-on-one battles, up to three teams can play against each other, or up to six players can play a free-for-all battle._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Battle fields included are Geonosis Arena, Emperor's Throne Room, Carbon-Freezing Chamber, and Kamino Platform. The game includes 31 decorated figures from across the entire Star Wars spectrum, 12 character cards (which have major and minor character life trackers on them), 378 action cards (31 per character group), 4 battle field boards, 1 movement die, wound markers, and rules._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

I am selling a very good condition copy of Epic Duels. The box has very minor creasing on the top with a very slight paper (not structure) damage to one corner. The paper is worn through at one spot. This one kills me. Purchased new for my son. He played with it several times, usually just with the figures. Box has typical shelf wear but no stains and corners are intact. All figures present, but Yoda and Anakin have broken lightsabers. The gameboards are in perfect shape. THe character cards are in perfect shape. The die is in perfect shape. The cheap insert, which was sold new taped together, needs retaped. The decks are stored in deck boxes and the cards are clean. The wound markers are all here, along with the quick guide cards. So far, not bad at all, right? But it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s missing cards. Oof. All characters should have 31 cards. A count revealed: Anakin, 30 Boba Fett, 14 (Ouch) Count Dooku, 31 Darth Maul, 29 Darth Vader, 23 Emperor Palpatine, 28 Han Solo, 27 Jango Fett, 31 Luke Skywalker, 30 Mace Windu, 29 Obi-Wan Kenobi, 18 (Sigh) Yoda, 30 All in all, it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s a playable copy. The decks can be found cheaply on eBay. The 2 figures with broken sabers can be replaced via eBay as well.
